Every day, Betclic is committed to fueling the passion for sports by providing players with the best entertainment experience through innovative cutting-edge technologies, ensuring a safe and healthy gaming environment.Betclic, headquartered in Bordeaux, France, is a multicultural and international company with nearly 950 employees spread across 5 European countries : France, Italy, Malta, Poland, and Portugal.Do you have a passion for the world of sports and gaming? Do you enjoy challenges and contributing to collective efforts? Join the adventure ! ENTER THE GAMEYou will join the Data Analytics team, part of a larger Data team which also includes Data Science, Data Product Management and Product Analytics teams. The Analytics team mission is to grow the business by identifying critical insights and high value opportunities. You'll integrate a fast growing team of +30 passionate individuals tackling challenges of all sorts : from scaling marketing campaign analytics to building complex customer segmentations to predicting the outcome of the next football game.YOUR ROLE WITHIN BETCLICWe are looking for an Analytics Manager to lead our Safer Gaming Analytics team, whose role is to help improve detection and protection of risky gambling, a core topic for Betclic. Working directly with the Safer Gaming department, your analysis will significantly contribute to defining a relevant long-term strategy for the department and to assessing its impact on our players.The Safer Gaming Analytics team being a small team to date, you will BE in charge of managing 1 Data Analyst and handling interactions with business stakeholders alongside with the Safer Gaming Data Product Owner. As such, this is a role involving close interactions with business executives and departmental heads, including Betclic's top management.Your responsibilities will BE :-  Help up-skill the Data Analyst of the team, providing hands-on technical and business guidance when needed.-  Ensure high quality of team's insights and output.-  Define the evolution of our analytical strategy on performance analytics and key strategic projects.-  Maintain close relationships with stakeholders from business teams, and our partner teams on the data engineering and data science side.-  Influence the business teams when needed, pushing them to adopt the right KPIs and the right strategy.WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR?This job is for you if :-  You have a Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or Computer Science or equivalent from a top university-  You are proficient in SQL & Python-  You have experience managing and growing Data Analytics teams-  You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills-  You are a team player, able to collaborate effectively in a matrix environment and influence cross-functional teams without formal authority-  Experience in a gaming industry is a plusWHAT ARE THE RECRUITMENT STEPS?-  Shall your application BE retained, you'll BE contacted by Elodie to pass an online technical test & a 30-minutes HR screening-  You'll then BE asked to pass the AssessFirst test (drive, fit & reasoning)-  You'll then meet 2 data team members : Xavier - Senior Analytics Manager (and hiring manager) and Iouri - Chief Data Officer-  After that, you'll meet key business stakeholders you would BE directly working with-  Finally, Elodie will see you again for a final HR interview during which we'll discuss your AssessFirst test resultsIn order to provide an optimal applicant experience, the overall hiring process at Betclic lasts 4 to 6 weeks.WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT?-  Open-minded and respectful team mates with a sense of humor and passionate with the job !-  Access to a state of the art data stack (Snowflake, Airflow, git, Tableau...)-  Complex challenges with well structured data thanks to our BI team, let's start analyzing-  Vibrant analytical topics : imagine the future of online gambling-  Regular training on skills you want to develop further (ML, Stats but also French or English classes)-  An attractive compensation package-  25 days of paid leave and 10 days of compensatory REST-  A Ticket Restaurant card® funded to the tune of 50% (10 Euros/day)-  A health insurance policy covered up to 100% for you and your children-  A transport subscription supported up to 50% or an annual premium of sustainable mobility (200 Euros for the journey home-work in sustainable transport)-  A mobility pack (moving aid)-  Work flexibility covered by a telecommuting agreement (min 4 days per month at the office)-  A constant focus on skills development with a personalized annual training program-  Career development in an international environment-  Unique premises with a rooftop designed to enjoy regular entertainment, breaks and lunches in the sun in front of the Cité du Vin-  Sports sessions twice a weekAnd the opportunity to work in a friendly, youthful and fun atmosphere !Indefinite contract position to BE filled as soon as possible. All of our positions are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Data Driven - Data Scientist H/F
Description: Devoteam Data Driven est l'équipe spécialiste de la Data du Groupe Devoteam, leader du conseil en stratégie digitale, plateformes technologiques, data, et cybersécurité. Nous sommes présents dans 8 pays et comptons plus de 1000 collaborateurs EMEA dont 300 en France.Dans un univers en constante évolution, notre ambition est d'accompagner les organisations qui ont décidé de placer les données au coeur de leur stratégie. Nous les aidons à transformer la valeur de leurs données en succès durable.90% des données mondiales ont été générées au cours des deux dernières années... Chaque organisation est engagée dans cette opportunité de passer à la vitesse supérieure.C'est là que nous intervenons. Nos partenaires 100% Cloud et Data (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake, PowerBI et Tableau) et nos 3 domaines d'expertise (Data Strategy, Data Foundation et Data for Business) nous permettent d'aider nos clients dans leur quête d'agilité, de compétitivité et de croissance.Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?Être formé(e) en continu : Devoteam Data Driven a développé un programme solide de formations & certifications (partenariats avec Databricks, Snowflake, PowerBI, Tableau, Dataiku, etc.) notamment sur les technologies cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure...)Intervenir sur des sujets variés et pointus : Devoteam Data Driven intervient dans de nombreux secteurs d'activité (Retail, luxe, média, télécoms, banque, industrie...) pour des grands comptes internationauxRejoindre une société spécialisée : Devoteam Data Driven ne fait que de la data  La garantie d'intervenir sur des sujets précis au coeur de votre expertiseIntégrer une équipe : Devoteam Data Driven c'est avant tout une équipe à taille humaine bénéficiant de l'écosystème d'un grand groupeLe Groupe Devoteam oeuvre pour l'égalité des chances, pour la promotion de ses collaboratrices et de ses collaborateurs au mérite et lutte activement contre toute forme de discrimination. Nous sommes persuadés que la diversité contribue à la créativité, au dynamisme et à l'excellence de notre organisation. Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicapIssu(e) d'une formation supérieure Bac +5 ou plus (école d'ingénieurs, doctorat, master, master spécialisé), nous recherchons des collaborateurs avec différents niveaux de séniorité tels que des Consultants, Senior Consultants, Lead Consultants, Project Managers...Votre quotidien :En tant que Data Scientist, vous contribuerez à la réalisation de projets technologiques en modélisation et en Intelligence Artificielle. Votre mission consistera à répondre à un besoin métier grâce à la data science, de bout en bout : concevoir, analyser, développer, tester et industrialiser. Vous serez fortement impliqué(e) dans la mise en oeuvre et l'industrialisation de modèles de Machine Learning sur des cas d'usage clients variés : allant du marketing prédictif (segmentation clients, scoring, recommandation de produits ou détection de fraude) à la reconnaissance d'images (deep learning), en passant par le traitement naturel du langage (NLP).Vos compétences techniques :Vous maîtrisez idéalement l'un des principaux langages de programmation (Python, Pyspark, Spark, R, Scala), les principaux outils du marché (Dataiku, Databricks, etc.), les bases de données (SQL, NoSQL) et vous disposez d'une expérience avérée en Data Science (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, NLP, etc.)Vous êtes passionné(e) par la data, doté(e) d'un très bon relationnel et curieux. Vous savez faire preuve d'une capacité de prise de recul. Garant de la connaissance métier à travers l'appropriation des enjeux et des problématiques opérationnelles, votre expertise technique vous permet d'être force de proposition dans la mise en place de nouveaux cas d'usage client dans votre domaine de compétences.

Title: Underwriting Data Scientist - Intern H/F
Description: ABOUT DESCARTES UNDERWRITINGDescartes was born out of the conviction that climate change calls for a revolutionary approach in insurance to better protect corporations, governments, and vulnerable communities. We offer a new generation of parametric insurance that builds resilience against the full spectrum of climate and emerging risks. Utilizing Machine Learning and real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT, our state-of-the-art climate tech provides innovative coverage for all trade sectors in all regions of the world. After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, Descartes Underwriting is proud to BE recognized among the French Tech Next40 and launched Descartes Insurance, a full stack' insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French Regulator (ACPR). With a growing corporate client base (350+ and counting) - our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 13 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan.ABOUT YOUR ROLEDue to rapid growth, we are seeking to expand our Underwriting team and we are looking for a Data Scientist Intern (end of study). At the core of our company's strategy, your missions will focus on making direct contributions to the development of new climate models of forecasting tools :If you join the Underwriting team, your key missions will include :-  Improving      or developing new algorithms, new risk models and products for our B2B      client;-  Identifying,      implementing and deploying new statistical and machine learning methods to      differentiate Descartes from its competitors;-  Participating      in the development of Descartes' technological platform;-  Collaborating      with the business team to understand client needs and issues to further      strengthen our technical excellence;-  Taking      on management responsibilities as both you and the company develop;-  Participating      in our R&D sessions.ABOUT YOUEXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS-  Final year Masters student in computer science, data science, applied mathematics, physics, statistics or meteorological studies;-  Ideally a previous      professional experience (internship or/and project) in Data Science.SKILLS-  Keen interest in      climate related topics;-  Highly skilled in      statistics, applied mathematics and machine learning methods;-  Fluency in English      (written and verbal communication) required;-  Proficient in      Python.MINDSET-  Interested in      weather and natural perils modelling (wildfires, hail, tsunamis,      earthquakes etc);-  Strong team spirit      and ability to work under pressure;-  Highly motivated,      able to meet deadlines set;-  Strong desire to learn      and commitment to the organization's mission;-  Results oriented,      high energy, with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural      environment;-  Motivated to help      improving businesses' and communities' resilience to climate change;-  Eagerness to work      in an international environment.WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING?-  Opportunity to work and learn with top data scientists from the most prestigious schools and research labs in the world, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;-  Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.);-  Benefit from a competitive compensation;-  Work in a collaborative & professional environment;-  BE part of an international team, passionate about diversityHOW TO APPLY?You may check off several but not necessarily all the expected boxes ? Motivation and feeling are key elements for us !If you want to develop your skills and work in a friendly startup atmosphere, don't hesitate and send us your application ! https://www.descartesunderwriting.com/careers/At Descartes Underwriting, we are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.RECRUITMENT PROCESS-  Step 1 : Call and      HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter-  Step 2 :      Technical online test-  Step 3 : In-person      interview with a Data Scientist-  Step 4 : Final      round interview with an Underwriting Manager and our Data Scientist team

Title: Data Scientist - Stage H/F
Description: Job DescriptionHello Watt développe une application permettant d'orienter les particuliers vers des actions d'économie d'énergie pertinentes. Intégré.e à l'équipe de Data Science, vous serez au coeur du projet de R&D porté par Hello Watt, à savoir :Concevoir des algorithmes chargés d'analyser les consommations d'énergie des particuliers en utilisant les données des compteurs communicants Linky et Gazpar respectivement déployés par ENEDIS et GRDF.Concevoir des modèles originaux de désagrégation de l'énergie et de détection des anomalies.Structurer les données provenant des différentes branches de l'entreprise (comportements utilisateur, données de marché, données commerciales) et les transformer en informations par la production de rapports, d'études, de modèles et d'analyses.Réaliser et publier des études sur l'utilisation de l'énergie en France par les particuliers.Pourquoi Hello Watt ?Vous avez envie de continuer la recherche dure dans un environnement où vos travaux sont valorisés rapidement en production, et publiés dans des journaux et conférences scientifiques.Vous souhaitez intégrer une Greentech travaillant sur un produit à la pointe en Europe-Vous souhaitez utiliser la data pour proposer des services permettant de réduire l'empreinte carbone et les factures d'énergie

Title: Ad Reprocessing Software Developer - Senior H/F
Description: The newly shaped Software Organization is currently seeking a brilliant Software developer to join the Autonomous Driving Reprocessing team.As a Reprocessing Engineer you will BE required to develop and deploy the software's / applications on the Reprocessing platform, which enables our stakeholders to perform tests on the data collected from the Test vehicles.

Title: Senior Data Scientist H/F
Description: The PositionWe seek an experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science team in Paris. In this role, you will advance our SEO end-to-end platform by harnessing the power of data and machine learning. Join us in shaping the future of data-driven SEO solutions and enhancing the digital landscapes of our valued customers.The TeamOur Data Science team is an integral part of the complete project lifecycle, engaging from inception and definition through to release and evaluation. With the ability to process 5+ Petabytes of data, we leverage advanced statistics and large-scale machine-learning algorithms to tackle our customers' most pressing challenges.Some notable projects that our team has recently undertaken :-  Internal Linking Optimization : Leveraging data science techniques, we develop algorithms to create optimal internal link structures, enhancing the visibility of our clients' web content to boost traffic and revenue.-  Issue Resolution Potential Estimation : Using advanced machine learning approaches to assess the potential impact of resolving website issues allows us to prioritize and address critical issues that can significantly improve overall website performance.-  Issue Detection and Alerts : Employing forecasting algorithms and anomaly detection techniques to identify potential issues by analyzing historical data to promptly alert our customers to any anomalies or concerns, ensuring their websites run smoothly.To explore more about our engineering teams and their work, visit our Medium Blog.Responsibilities :-  Exploratory Complex Analysis : Conducting in-depth exploratory analysis to assess opportunities and evaluate potential approaches for addressing complex business challenges. Your insights will guide data-driven decision-making for our product team.-  Research and Development : Engaging in research and development activities to pioneer machine learning and natural language processing solutions that drive innovation and enable the creation of cutting-edge products.-  Cross-functional Collaboration : Collaborating closely with fellow data scientists and engineers to effectively prototype and deploy solutions at scale.Requirements :-  A minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in developing algorithms and applying machine learning models to solve complex business problems.-  A deep knowledge and understanding of statistics and machine learning algorithms.-  Proven ability to write code in Python.-  Experience working with SQL and handling relational data.-  A team player with a pragmatic and iterative approach, with excellent communication skills.-  Professional proficiency in English and French.Hiring Process :-  30min Technical Screen-  1h Product & Machine Learning Interview-  1h Coding & Data Manipulation Interview-  30min Hiring Manager InterviewWe have a strong culture of sharing : As part of the engineering team, we participate in customer support and bug triaging/mitigation a few weeks per year. We also collaborate with our data science and analytics teams, give talks, animate workshops, coach other team members, and of course are very creative during our hackathons.To read more about our engineering team, visit our Medium Blog.What We OfferTo keep our employees happy and motivated, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we'd like to highlight :-  Location : brand new offices in the center of Paris (12 rue d'Amsterdam, straight out of Gare Saint-Lazare)-  Flexible Remote Policy - based in France-  Fun office culture & regular outings such as Team Off-Sites, Annual Kick-Off, Quarterly Team Lunch, Thirsty Thursdays etc.-  Lunch vouchers, 50% of transportation reimbursement, fitness classes, generous CSE advantages etc.-  Compelling growth perspectives-  Start date : as soon as possibleAbout BotifyFounded in 2012, Botify built the interface and methodology that automatically connects the enterprise websites with all the major search engines to drive sustainable and profitable results from the organic search channel.Botify's unified data model, prescriptive insights, and automated processes are used by hundreds of the world's largest enterprises spanning industries including e-commerce (REI, Macy's, Farfetch), e-travel (Expedia, TUI), media (Axel Springer, Condé Nast, Refinery29), marketplace/classifieds (eBay, RetailMeNot, Monster), and digital agencies (Merkle, iProspect, GroupM).A fast-growing, VC-backed, SaaS company with $82M in funding, Botify has offices in New York, Seattle, Paris, London, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney.Botify is proud to BE an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Stage Assistant Business Planner Product Merchandising - Mode Europe - Mars 2024 H/F
Description: Intégré(e) au sein de l'équipe Merchandising Produit Mode Europe, vous assisterez le Business Planner dans ses missions de pilotage de l'activité et de gestion de projets.Missions :1. Accompagner le Business Planner dans le pilotage de l'activité de l'ensemble des boutiques Europe :Participer à l'élaboration et l'amélioration des outils de reporting de performances des boutiques (Ventes, Stock, Sell Through, Month of Coverage) ;Planification et optimisation de stocks entre les boutiques et pays (diversions, transferts, etc.) en coordination avec la supply chain et le stock central ;Aider aux analyses pour l'achat centralisé et la gestion en réassort automatique des produits iconiques de la Maison ;Participer au maintien et aux mises à jour des bases de données Europe avec les équipes dataAider à la gestion des fins de livraison en lien avec la Supply Chain.Comprendre les objectifs des boutiques et analyser les tendances du marché.2. Accompagner le Business Planner dans ses projetsAider le Business Planner dans son rôle de Key-User Product Merchandising sur l'outil de prévisions de ventes et calcul des enveloppes d'achats ;Participer à l'organisation des sessions de calcul de Forecast Commerciaux avec les marchés ;S'assurer de la fiabilité des données et de la maintenance des dashboards de monitoring des achats dédiés aux boutiques (PowerBI) ;Participer au projet d'amélioration des prévisions de ventes de nos iconiques par des méthodes de Data Science ;Participer au projet à l'automatisation et à l'amélioration continue des processus pour la gestion centralisée des produits iconiques.Profil :Prochainement diplômé(e) d'une Ecole d'Ingénieur de préférence (Bac +5), vous avez une forte appétence pour l'analytique et la gestion de projet. Vous maîtrisez l'Anglais et le Pack Office (Excel, Power Point...) et êtes reconnu(e) pour votre curiosité, votre rigueur, votre autonomie et votre capacité d'adaptation.La connaissance de VBA, Power BI est un plus.Lieu : ParisDate : Stage à pourvoir dès Mars 2024

Title: Ux Designer Data Products & Services Mobilisights H/F
Description: Your MissionWe are on a mission to BE a leading global provider of highest quality data products, services, and rich, actionable insights derived from connected car data in a privacy compliant, non-discriminatory, and easy to consume fashion.As a UX Designer, Data Products & Services you will own the design & workflow definition for the data platform user interfaces for internal & external platform users. This is a key leadership role that will spearhead rapid buildout and delivery of data products and services to enable existing and emerging use-cases across a variety of market segments, ensuring its sustained long-term revenue growth. In this role, you should BE an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential. Ultimately, you will make our product user-friendly and intuitive attracting and retaining customers.We're looking for an individual with problem-solving aptitude, an analytical mind with a business acumen and excellent design & communication skills.Responsibilities include but are not limited to,- Lead discovery of user requirements for a growing set of use-cases for multiple market segments by engaging with customers and prospects as well as GTM, Marketing, and Planning & Operations teams. Identify target user groups and carry out interviews or other types of inquiry to help understand user needs. Document user requirements. Communicate design ideas & workflows to the Product Owner & Development team. Use creative methods to solve UX problems.- Understand product specifications and user psychology and predict what might work for both.- Partner with Product Managers & Product Owners to create wireframe/UX prototype to create industry leading UI/UX experience for internal as well as external customers. Produce high-quality solutions through flow diagrams, graphic designs, storyboards and site maps. Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback defining the interaction model.- Provide guidance on the implementation of UX research techniques and testing activities to assess user behavior. Establish design best practices including definition of UX/UI processes.- Partner with development teams on fast prototyping innovative product ideas for demos and customer pilots.- Partner with Product Owner in user story definitions for the UX and exit criteria for user stories.- Collaborate with data governance and tech teams on institutionalizing strong data governance policy for data management of partner/3rd party data to ensure data privacy compliance with GDPR and CCPA.- Work closely with Marketing and GTM teams to assist on product marketing deliverables including product demos & to keep abreast of competitive & industry trends.

Title: Ingénieur d'Études Thermohydraulique Nucléaire H/F
Description: La mission de CS GROUP : être à la pointe des technologies pour garantir la sécurité de tous dans un monde en pleine mutation. L'expertise reconnue du groupe lui permet d'intervenir là où les enjeux de sécurité sont les plus sensibles : aéronautique, défense, énergie, spatial... Et, aussi, là où les réponses sont à inventer ou à réinventer : lutte anti-drones, cybersécurité, traitement de données satellitaires...Vous souhaitez évoluer dans une entreprise à dimension humaine qui encourage l'innovation, la curiosité et la prise de responsabilités ? Un groupe qui cultive la diversité de ces métiers, issus de l'univers IT mais aussi du monde scientifique et qui investit près de 15% de son CA en R&D ? Rejoignez-nous et additionnons nos talents !Nous recrutons un/une Ingénieur d'études Thermohydraulique nucléaire pour rejoindre notre Business Line Simulation numérique à Grenoble.Le Pôle de compétence Simulation numérique regroupe notre expertise dans les domaines du calcul scientifique, de la modélisation, de l'ingénierie de code (conception, développement, MCO, plateforme de couplage, HPC) et des études de phénomènes physiques complexes (mécanique et géomécanique, fluidique, génie-atomique, mécanique spatial...).Vos missions :-  Construction et/ou optimisation de modèles de simulation,-  Réalisation de simulations thermohydrauliques monophasiques - diphasiques en fonctionnement normal, accidentel et incidents,-  Réalisation de calculs d'essai issus des programmes expérimentaux,-  Réalisation de pré-calculs pour contribuer à la proposition ou à la spécification de nouveaux essais,-  Vérification des critères de sûreté,-  Rédaction de notes de calcul et rapports,présentation des résultats au client.Qui sommes-nous ?La Business Unit INDUSTRIE contribue aux développements de programmes dans les domaines de la simulation, la transformation digitale et le développement de systèmes critiques. Elle est un acteur référent sur l'Intelligence de la donnée (Data Engineering & Data Science), la digitalisation des processus (PLM), la simulation numérique, le développement de logiciels embarqués & certifiés ainsi que la sécurisation des systèmes (cybersécurité).Qui êtes-vous?De formation Bac +5 dans un univers scientifique ou technique vous avez une spécialisation en Thermohydraulique, Génie Atomique orientée modélisation et simulation numérique.Votre champ de compétences :-  Maîtrise des codes de thermohydraulique (Cathare, Thyc, Flica)-  Compétences en modélisation des transitoires.-  Connaissance du fonctionnement des centrales nucléairesPas d'inquiétude si vous n'avez pas toutes les compétences requises, car CS GROUP accompagnera votre développement de compétences dans le cadre de sa CS ACADEMY.N'attendez plus, partagez votre CV et additionnons nos talents !

Title: Data - Ml Engineer H/F
Description: Meetic relies heavily on data to pilot and develop its activities. A truly data-driven company, data is our daily compass in our decision-making.The Data Science team is at the crossroads of the company's key issues and takes maximum advantage of all the information contained in our data. IT is part of the Meetic Data Hub made up of all data stakeholders (Data Science, ML/Data Engineer, DBA, BI).Our vast data ecosystem allows us to intervene in all business areas : recommendation of profiles for our users, pricing and optimization of business models, optimization of our subscription and à la carte offers, customer knowledge and experience, fight against bad behavior, marketing analytics and acquisition, image processing... and more !Technical environment : Google Vertex AI, Big Query, Elastic Search Scala, Python, Spark, SQL, Hadoop, PostgreSQL, Oracle, PowerBI, AWS...We are looking for creative and passionate personalities who enjoy working in a dynamic and international environment.The position :-  Explore, design and build AI prototypes capable of significantly changing our users' experience.-  Work closely with Data Scientists to create ML solutions, test new algorithms, provide feedback on their performance, accuracy and scalability, and also suggest alternatives.-  Produce optimized, efficient, scalable, testable, maintainable and observable code.-  Design and implement pipelines that ingest large amounts of data in real time to feed models and generate accurate results.-  Manage ML model lifecycles, including versioning, training, retraining, deployment and monitoring.-  BE responsible for the maintenance and operation of algorithms, code and models in production and monitor models in production to ensure they are working and report any anomalies.-  Algorithm optimization :-  Participate in the development and implementation of recommendation and monetization algorithms...-  Design, develop and implement the data pipelines necessary to implement the predictive models.-  Testing and evaluation :-  Evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics.-  Perform and track the performance of A/B tests to validate new features and improvements.-  Collaboration :-  Work in an international and multi-brand context with teams in Europe, Canada and the USA.-  Participate in the ML/AI center of excellence to improve the customer experience and take advantage of generative AI for all the group's brands.-  Work closely with product squads and Growth teams to understand and meet their needs.-  Work with data engineers to ensure the quality of our data and the production of our models.-  Evangelize a data-driven culture in a highly collaborative environment. We want you to share your expertise !-  Technology culture :-  Stay up to date with advances in machine learning and data analytics to apply best practices to our business.Qualifications - mandatory :-  Profile :-  With a 5-year degree (Engineering, software or mathematics), you have at least 5 years' experience in a similar position.-  You like to discover scientific methods and challenge those in place. You keep in mind the purpose of your work : Improve the performance of our dating application !-  Hard Skills :-  Full operational competencies in Python, Scala, Spark, SQL languages-  Full operational competencies in data bases Elasticsearch, Postgresql, Oracle, SQL Server-  Full operational competencies in tools of GCP's machine learning (Vertex AI, Big Query...)-  Full operational competencies in Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques-  Soft Skills :-  You are comfortable communicating in English during meetings and day-to-day activities-  Excellent capacity for analysis and synthesis-  Excellent written and oral communication skills-  Rigorous scientific approach-  Team spirit and proactivity-  Curiosity and ability to learnQualifications - Nice to have :-  Knowledge of TensorFlow or PyTorch-  Full operational competencies in Qlikview/Tableau or other BI toolsWhat we offer :Operate in an international and multicultural environmentA gorgeous working environment in the heart of Paris, spacious and modern office, rooftop, close to transport and amenitiesMany quality moments of sharing : office activities, summer party, team buildingsCompetitive package in line with the marketEnjoy work-life balanceEdenred lunch voucherClasspass gym discountsPremium healthcare coverage with WTWUse our products free of chargeTech environment :Learn through e-learning, conferences, Meetups and sharing sessionsAgile, collaborative, stimulating and dynamic work environmentMicroservice architecture in constant evolutionTech Culture : crafts, autonomy and knowledge sharingExpress your creativity by participating in our hackathonsWork for a product with a high societal impactHiring Process :A first conversation on the phone with Vincent (Talent Acquisition Specialist) (~45 min zoom)A meeting with Sihem (Engineering Manager Data) (your future manager) and Jean-Marc (Engineer Director) (60 min onsite or zoom)A technical meeting to evaluate your competencies (60 min zoom). This interview could BE in full English.A meeting with Belinda (People Manager) (60 min onsite or zoom)Some part of interviews could BE in English.On your initial days, the HR Team and your team will make sure you start under excellent conditions.Practical information :Contract start : As soon as you are ready !Location : 53 Rue de Châteaudun, Paris 75009WFH Policy : Hybrid, between 2 and 3 days at the office per week requiredContract : CDI / Full TimeMeetic is an employer that respects equal opportunities and diversity.

Title: Ad Software Engineer - Junior H/F
Description: The newly shaped Software Organization is currently seeking brilliant Software Engineers to join the Autonomous Driving software team.As a Software Engineer you will BE required to design and develop clean and highly scalable code for our Autonomous Driving stack. You will test your solutions on SiL, HiL, ViL and on the real vehicles, and so you will have a big impact on shaping our present and future autonomous driving products.

Title: Data Ba Datawarehouse Strategy CDI H/F
Description: IDS - Data BA - Data Warehouse stratégie. Vélizy 2j TT/SEM   du 01/01/2024 au 31/12/2024Experience in an multinational Company with complex organizational ecosystem.  Working in the cloud with micro-services would certainly BE a plus. You already have a significant experience as a technical lead or architect (>5 years).Environment :As a member of the DWH as a Service Squad for a Specific Domain you will actively contribute to data products across the Enterprise.Data as a Product -  DeliveryFor each New Data Product, you will support turning business orientations into robust and performant data Models. In addition, You will also :·        Advise and push modern data architecture patterns and solutions answering present needs and putting the Squads & Data Engineers in a position to scale considering complexity.·        Support the upfront Discovery Phases before launching a new Data Warehouse as a service by shaping the most relevant Data modeling approach depending on the use case.·        Work closely with the Data Governance Teams to align Business orientation with the Group PolicyAs a BA Data, You will BE an active contributor to  the function DataWarehouse Strategy :Drive User/ Business interviews to map out the Domain Business Process & the Data FlowSupport the Functional Data Manager to define Data Objects & Data Ingestion RoadmapDefine Data Flow Specs from Source System to the DWHDefine Conceptual Data Model, B.Os & Fill the Data Library SystemDefine the adequate Data Modeling pattern (Vault, Kimball, etc.) to address the Business needsDefine & Implement Data Quality ProcessFacilitate DataWarehouse Delivery  with the Sqaud, Data Engineers & Function Data ManagerDefine & implement the target state of Self Service BI architecture patternsOur current & future Data StackTalendDataGalaxySSASPower BIMS SQL ServerMinIOKafkaTrinoELKAzure Data FactorySSISBigQuery (Future)Profil :Who you are·        As a data expert you have a solid technical background and experience in data-intensive systems (> 10 years).·        Experience in an multinational Company with complex organizational ecosystem.  Working in the cloud with micro-services would certainly BE a plus. You already have a significant experience as a technical lead or architect (>5 years).·        Experience working with large amount of data, Big Data processing - batch and streaming Kafka, Flink, Talend (Experience with any one of them would BE a plus)·        Completely Comfortable Working in a highly sensitive On-Prem data environment, where security constraints are part of the adventure·        You have experience with architectural patterns of large-scale applications.·        You have deep knowledge and experience in Data Modeling, databases, DataMarts,, Data Governance, Data Security, BI tools, ETL Solutions, Data Science, DataOps, MLOPS.·        You know how to work with data engineers, data scientists, data analysts, architects, product owners, top management.·        You have the right mindset : You are autonomous and know where and when to take decisions taking into account the constraints.·        You are dynamic & curious, with an agile mindset and a strong team spirit that allow you to adapt to a changing environment.·        You are comfortable writing and speaking in English.
